page.title: 19Maghull Homes and Hospitals
page.content: {Moss Side and Park Lane Hospitals}deal with patients detained under the Mental Health Act and admitted directly from courts or transferred from prison or NHS hospitals.They provide a comprehensive range of psychiatric treatment in conditions of special security.Moss Side originated as an epileptic colony but has been used for mental patients since 1930.Park Lane was completed in 1984 to relieve over crowding at Broadmoor. In July 1985 there were 197 male and 62 female patients at Moss Side and 294 male patients at Park Lane.The latter was designed to cater for the more intelligent patient who are mentally ill and with personality and psychopathic disorders.A great deal of emphasis is put on rehabilitation and 1979_1984 an average of 53 patients per annum were discharged.
